result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse A. Kost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse A. Kost is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse A. Kost was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:35 am Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jesse A. Kost in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf206, 14cf148 and 14cf181. All parties in receipt in PSI -Richards notes correction on  pg 32 recommendation to Count 5 - Misdemeanor charge, should be 9 months. All parties in receipt of revocation packets in 14cf148 and 14cf181. 
In 16cf206  - Schiek/Richards/Court statement on restitution. Court requests restition information be documented in writing and investigated by both parties-will schedule restitution hearing. Witness, S.L.W., statement on sentencing. Schiek statement on sentencing. Richards statement on sentencing. Defendant statement to witness and statement to Court on sentencing. Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
16cf206
Count 2 
Prison - 4 - 1/2 years
Initial Confinement - 2 1/2 years
Extended Supervision - 2 years
Restitution - to be determined within 30 days; defense counsel to have 20 days after that to stipulate; if no stipulation then restitution hearing will be scheduled
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Count 5
CC
Jail - 9 months
Jail credit - 161 days

14CF148
Prison - 4 1/2 years
Initial Confinement - 2 - 1/2 years
Extended Supervision - 2 years
Jail credit - 320 days
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

14CF181

Jail credit - 293 days
Any financial obligations are reduce to civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. WEDS given.
Adj. 10:15 a.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 9:02 am Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jesse A. Kost in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf206, 14cf181 and 14cf148. Schiek/Richards - request that plea be taken today in 16cf206 - requests PSI and requests adjournment on 14cf181 and 14cf148 to track for global resolution. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 1 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 2 to strike repeater enhancer - Granted. State moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 3 and 4 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 5 to failure to report - violation of 946.425(1) - a misdemeanor - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI - author does not need to appear. Schiek anticipates witness testimony at sentencing hearing. Court sets alternate date for sentencing hearing in event PSI is not completed timely. Bail continued. Adj. 9:14 am  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 11:00 am.

State moves to dismiss Ct. 2 in 14CF181 and Cts. 1 & 3 in 14CF148; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1 in 14CF181 and Ct. 2 in 14CF148. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty.

09:00 am - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Jesse A. Kost in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf148 and 14cf181.  Currently set at $500 cash in each case.  Bayne-Allison/Michlig statement to motion.  Court modifies bond to $3500 sig - no intoxicants, no taverns, no contact with anyone on probation or parole, no controlled substances.
no intoxicants, no taverns, no contact with anyone on probation or parole, no controlled substances.
from defendant to Judge O'Melia and reply from judge concerning modification to bond
If unable to post cash - may attend inpatient treatment at Koinonia.

11:09 am - Defendant Jesse A. Kost in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Defendant Jesse A. Kost in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf181 (initial appr), 14cf148 (prelim) and 14cf28 (sehr).    In 14cf181 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  In 14cf181 and 14cf148 - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information in 14cf148.  Information for 14cf181 will mirror criminal complaint.  Proceed to Arraginment - not guilty pleas entered and set for PTC.  In 14CF181 - Michlig/Bayne Allison to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Also bond in 14cf148 modified to allow inpatient treatment at Koinonia if unable to post cash.  In 14cf28 - Michlig/Bayne-Allison/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence - Concurrent
Jail 90 days - may attend inpatient treatment and is to receive day for day credit if successfully completes inpatient treatment program - Jail credit 40 days
Court Costs reduced to civil judgment
Appeal rights given  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
